article_title: Merkel Holds Firm Against Calls to Give Carmakers More State Aid
article_text: LISTEN TO ARTICLE    1:10      SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"QGAJ71DWLU6M01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-08/merkel-holds-firm-against-calls-to-give-carmakers-more-state-aid"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-Ifu0OnZ"}      Photographer: Michaela Handrek-Rehle/Bloomberg    Photographer: Michaela Handrek-Rehle/Bloomberg   German car industry leaders emerged from a two-hour video conference with Angela Merkel empty-handed as the chancellor continues to resist calls for more state support for the sector.    After meeting with the heads of BMW AG, Daimler AG and Volkswagen AG, Merkel’s spokesman issued a statement committing only to further discussions of ways to support the industry. Earlier Tuesday, allies including Transport Minister Andreas Scheuer said purchase subsidies should be offered for combustion-engine cars to help weather the coronavirus pandemic.    {"contentId":"QGAJ71DWLU6M01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[1,8]],"small_desktop":[[1,8]],"tablet":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-08/merkel-holds-firm-against-calls-to-give-carmakers-more-state-aid"},"containerId":"outstream-video-1-QGAJ71DWLU6M01"}   {"contentId":"QGAJ71DWLU6M01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"mobile":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-08/merkel-holds-firm-against-calls-to-give-carmakers-more-state-aid"},"containerId":"outstream-video-2-QGAJ71DWLU6M01"}   Working groups will discuss free-market concepts to support the industry -- especially struggling suppliers -- until the group meets for another summit, Steffen Seibert, Merkel’s chief spokesman, said in a statement. The government also pledged to provide support for new technologies such as artificial intelligence and cloud computing, both of which are necessary for the development of autonomous vehicles.    {"contentId":"QGAJ71DWLU6M01","position":"box","dimensions":{"mobile":[[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"Mobile Body Box Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"box1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2020-09-08/merkel-holds-firm-against-calls-to-give-carmakers-more-state-aid"},"containerId":"box-WODI06q"}   The coronavirus crisis and the transformation of the global car industry will result in large numbers of job losses, the IW Cologne economic institute said in a study published Monday. Highly specialized small- and medium-sized suppliers will be hit particularly hard, IW said.     Published on ‎8‎ ‎September‎, ‎2020‎ ‎22‎:‎49        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
